tit.e: The Shigure-tei bunko (meaning the Shigure-tei storehouse/library) of the Reizei family
The Shigure-tei bunko (the Shigure-tei storehouse/library of the Reizei family)
tit.cmt: I don't think the word "meaning" is necessary here.
tit.e: The Shigure-tei Bunko (the Shigure-tei storehouse/library of the Reizei family)

sen.j: 財団法人冷泉家時雨亭文庫（れいぜいけしぐれていぶんこ）は、藤原定家の子孫であり、歌道の家として知られる冷泉家（上冷泉家）に伝わる古写本、建築、年中行事などの文化遺産を保存し、冷泉流古今伝授を継承することを目的として設立された。
sen.e: The Foundation for the Reizei family's Shigure-tei library was founded by the descendants of FUJIWARA no Teika; it was created both to store and protect the cultural treasures, including old manuscripts, architectural items, and reports of annual events that had been passed down in the Reizei family, which was well known as a poetic family, and for the purpose of instructing succeeding generations in the Reizei school of kokin denju, or interpretation of the poetry in the Kokinshu.

The Foundation for the Reizei family's Shigure-tei library was founded by the descendants of FUJIWARA no Teika; it was created both to store and protect the cultural treasures, including old manuscripts, architectural items, and reports of annual events that had been passed down in the Reizei family, which was well known as a poetic family, and for the purpose of instructing succeeding generations in the Reizei school of kokin denju, or interpretation of the poetry in the Kokinshu.

The Foundation for the Reizei family's Shigure-tei library was founded by the descendants of FUJIWARA no Teika; it was created both to store and protect the cultural treasures, including old manuscripts, architectural items, and reports of annual events that had been passed down in the Reizei family, which was well known as a poetic family, and for the purpose of instructing succeeding generations in the Reizei school of kokin denju, or interpretation of the poetry in the Kokinshu.

sen.j: 主たる事務所の所在地は京都市上京区今出川通り烏丸東入ル玄武町。
sen.e: The main office for the Shigure-tei library is in Gembumachi, Karasuma higashi-iru, Imaewgawa-dori, Kamigyo-ku, Kyoto.
The main office for the Shigure-tei library is in Gembumachi, Karasuma higashi-iru, Imaewgawa-dori, Kamigyo-ku, Kyoto.
The main office for the Shigure-tei library is in Genbumachi, Karasuma higashi-iru, Imadegawa-dori, Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 冷泉家は、藤原定家の孫・冷泉為相（ためすけ）を初代とする。
sen.e: The Reizei family was founded by FUJIWARA no Teika's grandson, Tamesuke REIZEI.
The Reizei family was founded by FUJIWARA no Teika's grandson, Tamesuke REIZEI.
The Reizei family was founded by FUJIWARA no Teika's grandson, Tamesuke REIZEI.

sen.j: 藤原道長の6男である藤原長家を祖とする御子左家（みこひだりけ）は、勅撰和歌集の撰者であった藤原俊成・定家以来、和歌の家としての格式をもっていた。
sen.e: The Mikohidari family, descended from FUJIWARA no Michinaga's sixth son FUJIWARA no Nagaie, enjoyed the social status of being known as a family skilled at waka poetry ever since the days of FUJIWARA no Toshinari and Teika, who were compilers of imperial waka anthologies.

The Mikohidari family, descended from FUJIWARA no Michinaga's sixth son FUJIWARA no Nagaie, enjoyed the social status of being known as a family skilled at waka poetry ever since the days of FUJIWARA no Toshinari and Teika, who were compilers of imperial waka anthologies.

The Mikohidari family, descended from FUJIWARA no Michinaga's sixth son FUJIWARA no Nagaie, enjoyed the social status of being known as a family skilled at waka poetry ever since the days of FUJIWARA no Toshinari and Teika, who were compilers of imperial waka anthologies.

sen.j: 藤原定家の子である藤原為家の死後、御子左家の家系は為家の嫡男為氏を祖とする二条家（五摂家の1つである二条家とは別系）、次男為教を祖とする京極家、三男為相を祖とする冷泉家の3家に分かれた。
sen.e: After the death of Teika's son FUJIWARA no Tameie, the Mikohidari family's lineage split into three branches: the Nijo family (a separate lineage from the Nijo family famous for being one of the Go-Sekke, the five families that produced regents) and their ancestor Tameuji, Tameie's eldest son and heir, the Kyogoku family, which was descended from Tameie's second son Tamenori, and the Reizei family, descended from Tameie's third son Tamesuke.

After the death of Teika's son FUJIWARA no Tameie, the Mikohidari family's lineage split into three branches: the Nijo family (a separate lineage from the Nijo family famous for being one of the Go-Sekke, the five families that produced regents) and their ancestor Tameuji, Tameie's eldest son and heir, the Kyogoku family, which was descended from Tameie's second son Tamenori, and the Reizei family, descended from Tameie's third son Tamesuke.

After the death of Teika's son FUJIWARA no Tameie, the Mikohidari family's lineage split into three branches: the Nijo family (a separate lineage from the Nijo family famous for being one of the Go-Sekke, the five families that produced regents) and their ancestor Tameuji, Tameie's eldest son and heir, the Kyogoku family, which was descended from Tameie's second son Tamenori, and the Reizei family, descended from Tameie's third son Tamesuke.

sen.j: このうち二条家と京極家は中世に断絶し、俊成・定家の血統を伝えるのは冷泉家のみとなった。
sen.e: But with the passage of time, both the Nijo and Kyogoku family lines ended during the medieval period, leaving the Reizei family the sole descendants of Toshinari and Teika's bloodline.
Of the three, both the Nijo and Kyogoku family lines ended during the medieval period, leaving the Reizei family the sole descendants of Toshinari and Teika's bloodline.
sen.cmt: "But with the passage of time" - "of the three" (このうち)
sen.e: Of the three, both the Nijo and Kyogoku family lines ended during the medieval period, leaving the Reizei family the sole descendants of Toshinari and Teika's bloodline.

sen.j: 冷泉家の初代である為相は、父為家とその後妻の阿仏尼との間に生まれた子である。
sen.e: Tamesuke, founder of the Reizei family, was a child born between his father Tameie and his wife later in life, Abutsuni.
Tamesuke, founder of the Reizei family, was a child born to his father Tameie and Abutsuni, the wife he took in his later years.
sen.cmt: "Between" - "to". I thought "and Abutsuni, the wife he took in his later years" would read a little better here.
sen.e: Tamesuke, founder of the Reizei family, was a child born to his father Tameie and Abutsuni, the wife he took in his later years.

sen.j: 為家は、長男為氏に与えるはずであった所領や伝来の歌書などを末子・為相に相続させている。
sen.e: And it was Tamesuke, Tameie's youngest son, not his eldest son and heir Tameuji, that Tameie had inherit his territories and ancestral waka anthologies.
And it was Tamesuke, Tameie's youngest son, not his eldest son and heir Tameuji, that Tameie had inherit his territories and ancestral waka anthologies.
And it was Tamesuke, Tameie's youngest son, not his eldest son and heir Tameuji, that Tameie had inherit his territories and ancestral waka anthologies.

sen.j: これは、為家が自分が60歳代になってからの子であった為相の行く末を案じたためであると言われているが、所領十六夜日記の所有権に関しては、冷泉家と二条家の間で長らく争論があった。
sen.e: It is said that this was because Tameie was concerned about the future his son, conceived when Tameie was in his sixties, would have, but in any case the Nijo and Reizei families entered into a long-running dispute concerning dominion over his territories and ownership of the Izayoi Nikki (Diary of the Night of the Sixteenth).

It is said that this was because Tameie was concerned about the future his son, conceived when Tameie was in his sixties, would have, but in any case the Nijo and Reizei families entered into a long-running dispute concerning dominion over his territories and ownership of the Izayoi Nikki (Diary of the Night of the Sixteenth).

It is said that this was because Tameie was concerned about the future his son, conceived when Tameie was in his sixties, would have, but in any case the Nijo and Reizei families entered into a long-running dispute concerning dominion over his territories and ownership of the Izayoi Nikki (Diary of the Night of the Sixteenth).

sen.j: 上冷泉家の屋敷は京都御苑の北、今出川通に南面し、東・北・西の三方は同志社大学の敷地に囲まれている。
sen.e: The estate of the Kami branch of the Reizei family is in the north section of the Kyoto Imperial Garden on the south side of Imadegawa-dori, and is currently surrounded on three sides--east, north, and west--by the campus of Doshisha University.

The estate of the Kami branch of the Reizei family is in the north section of the Kyoto Imperial Garden on the south side of Imadegawa-dori, and is currently surrounded on three sides--east, north, and west--by the campus of Doshisha University.

The estate of the Kami branch of the Reizei family is in the north section of the Kyoto Imperial Garden on the south side of Imadegawa-dori, and is currently surrounded on three sides--east, north, and west--by the campus of Doshisha University.

sen.j: この一帯は、豊臣秀吉の都市計画により公家屋敷が集中していた地域であったが、現存するのは冷泉家住宅のみである。
sen.e: This section of the city was the area under Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's city planning project in which nobles' mansions would be concentrated, but today, the Reizei residence is the only one remaining.
This section of the city was the area under Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's city planning project in which nobles' mansions would be concentrated, but today, the Reizei residence is the only one remaining.
This section of the city was the area under Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's city planning project in which nobles' mansions would be concentrated, but today, the Reizei residence is the only one remaining.

sen.j: 下冷泉家の屋敷は京都御苑内にあった。
sen.e: The mansion of the Shimo branch of the Reizei family was located within the grounds of the Kyoto Imperial Gardens.
The mansion of the Shimo branch of the Reizei family was located within the grounds of the Kyoto Imperial Gardens.
The mansion of the Shimo branch of the Reizei family was located within the grounds of the Kyoto Imperial Gardens.

sen.j: 上冷泉家は慶長11年（1606年）にはこの地に屋敷を構えていたことが知られる。
sen.e: As for the Kami branch of the Reizei family, it is known that they erected their own mansion at this site in 1606 (the eleventh year of the Keicho era).
As for the Kami branch of the Reizei family, it is known that they erected their own mansion at this site in 1606 (the eleventh year of the Keicho era).
As for the Kami branch of the Reizei family, it is known that they erected their own mansion at this site in 1606.
sen.cmt: (the eleventh year of the Keicho era)削除

sen.j: 天明8年（1788年）の京都の大火による焼失後、寛政2年（1790年）に再建されたのが、現存する冷泉家住宅（重要文化財）である。
sen.e: The Reizei family residence (an Important Cultural Property) that survives today was rebuilt in the second year of the Kansei era (1790), two years after being destroyed by the Great Tenmei Fire of Kyoto (which occurred in Tenmei 8, or 1788).

The Reizei family residence (an Important Cultural Property) that survives today was rebuilt in the second year of the Kansei era (1790), two years after being destroyed by the Great Tenmei Fire of Kyoto (which occurred in Tenmei 8, or 1788).
The Reizei family residence (an Important Cultural Property) that survives today was rebuilt in1790, two years after being destroyed by the Great Tenmei Fire of Kyoto (which occurred in 1788).
sen.cmt: the second year of the Kansei era 削除Tenmei 8, or 削除

sen.j: なお、古写本を多く伝えてきた土蔵「御文庫（おぶんこ）」は、天明の火災を免れたものと思われる。
sen.e: Moreover, the storehouse, or "obunko" (library), filled with the many old manuscripts that the family continued to pass down, is thought to have avoided the Great Tenmei Fire.
Moreover, the storehouse, or "obunko" (library), filled with the many old manuscripts that the family continued to pass down, is thought to have avoided the Great Tenmei Fire.
Moreover, the storehouse, or 'obunko' (library), filled with the many old manuscripts that the family continued to pass down, is thought to have avoided the Great Tenmei Fire.

sen.j: 近代に入って1917年には今出川通の拡幅工事に伴い曳家（ひきや、建物を解体せずに平行移動させること）が行われ、敷地も縮小したが、各建物の配置などは旧状をよくとどめているという。
sen.e: More recently, in 1917, as a consequence of the construction project to widen the Imadegawa-dori (street), the buildings were dragged (in other words, moved as is, without disassembling them) some distance away, and although the size of the Reizei plot of land was reduced, the positioning of the various buildings were kept largely in their old configuration.

More recently, in 1917, as a consequence of the construction project to widen the Imadegawa-dori (street), the buildings were dragged (in other words, moved as is, without disassembling them) some distance away, and although the size of the Reizei plot of land was reduced, the positioning of the various buildings were kept largely in their old configuration.

More recently, in 1917, as a consequence of the construction project to widen the Imadegawa-dori (street), the buildings were dragged (in other words, moved as is, without disassembling them) some distance away, and although the size of the Reizei plot of land was reduced, the positioning of the various buildings were kept largely in their old configuration.

sen.j: 上冷泉家の「御文庫」に保存されてきた古文書・古写本類は、一部研究者にはその存在が知られていたが、長らく非公開とされ、一般にその存在が知られるようになったのは1980年からである。
sen.e: The existence of such a wide variety of old documents and manuscripts preserved in the "obunko" (library) of the Kami branch of the Reizei family was known to a handful of researchers over the years, but the library remained private for a long time, so in general, the extent of their collection was not widely known until 1980.

The existence of such a wide variety of old documents and manuscripts preserved in the obunko (library) of the Kami branch of the Reizei family was known to a handful of researchers over the years, but the library remained private for a long time, so in general, the extent of their collection was not widely known until 1980.

The existence of such a wide variety of old documents and manuscripts preserved in the obunko (library) of the Kami branch of the Reizei family was known to a handful of researchers over the years, but the library remained private for a long time, so in general, the extent of their collection was not widely known until 1980.

sen.j: 同年より平安博物館（現京都文化博物館）によって冷泉家所蔵本の整理・目録作成が始められ、徐々にその全体像が明らかにされてきた。
sen.e: It was starting in the same year that the Heian Museum of Ancient History (today called the Museum of Kyoto) began putting in order and cataloging the collection of books belonging to the Reizei family, and little by little it became obvious just how extensive the collection was.

It was starting in the same year that the Heian Museum of Ancient History (today called the Museum of Kyoto) began putting in order and cataloging the collection of books belonging to the Reizei family, and little by little it became obvious just how extensive the collection was.

It was starting in the same year that the Heian Museum of Ancient History (today called the Museum of Kyoto) began putting in order and cataloging the collection of books belonging to the Reizei family, and little by little it became obvious just how extensive the collection was.

sen.j: 冷泉家所蔵本は、俊成・定家の自筆本や、定家の自筆日記『明月記』をはじめ、日本文学や日本中世史の研究上、貴重な資料の宝庫である。
sen.e: Books in the Reizei family library include writings in Toshinari's and Teika's own hands, and even Teika's own personal diary, the "Meigetsuki" (Chronicle of the Clear Moon), making the library a treasure trove of important documents in the study of Japanese literature and medieval Japanese history.

Books in the Reizei family library include writings in Toshinari's and Teika's own hands, and even Teika's own personal diary, the Meigetsuki (Chronicle of the Clear Moon), making the library a treasure trove of important documents in the study of Japanese literature and medieval Japanese history.

Books in the Reizei family library include writings in Toshinari's and Teika's own hands, and even Teika's own personal diary, the "Meigetsuki" (Chronicle of the Clear Moon), making the library a treasure trove of important documents in the study of Japanese literature and medieval Japanese history.

sen.j: また、冷泉家住宅は近世以前の公家住宅の現存唯一の遺構として貴重なものである。
sen.e: Furthermore, the Reizei family residence is the sole surviving example of pre-Edo period aristocratic dwellings, and as such is a treasure in its own right.
Furthermore, the Reizei family residence is the sole surviving example of pre-Edo period aristocratic dwellings, and as such is a treasure in its own right.
Furthermore, the Reizei family residence is the sole surviving example of pre-Edo period aristocratic dwellings, and as such is a treasure in its own right.

sen.j: こうした有形文化財に加え、乞巧奠（きっこうてん、七夕）のような昔ながらの年中行事や和歌の家としての伝統を保持するため、財団法人冷泉家時雨亭文庫が設立された。
sen.e: In addition to handling these tangible cultural properties, the Foundation of the Shigure-tei library of the Reizei family was established to preserve records of ancient cultural practices like the Tanabata Star Festival (the festival of the Weaver, which still takes place on the seventh day of the seventh month) as well, and to preserve the Reizei family's poetic conventions as a family famed for its waka poems.

In addition to handling these tangible cultural properties, the Foundation of the Shigure-tei library of the Reizei family was established to preserve records of ancient cultural practices like the Tanabata Star Festival (the festival of the Weaver, which still takes place on the seventh day of the seventh month) as well, and to preserve the Reizei family's poetic conventions as a family famed for its waka poems.

In addition to handling these tangible cultural properties, the Foundation of the Shigure-tei library of the Reizei family was established to preserve records of ancient cultural practices like the Tanabata Star Festival (the festival of the Weaver, which still takes place on the seventh day of the seventh month) as well, and to preserve the Reizei family's poetic conventions as a family famed for its waka poems.

sen.j: 「時雨亭」は、定家が京都の小倉山に構えた山荘の名である。
sen.e: "Shigure-tei" was the name of the mountain villa that Teika had built on Mt. Ogura in Kyoto.
"Shigure-tei" was the name of the mountain villa that Teika had built on Mt. Ogura in Kyoto.
Shigure-tei' was the name of the mountain villa that Teika had built on Mt. Ogura in Kyoto.

tit.e: Opening the Reizei family residence to the public
Opening the Reizei family residence to the public
Opening the Reizei family residence to the public

sen.j: 住宅、古写本とも長らく一般公開はされてこなかったが、1994年から2000年にかけて「平成の大修理」が行われたことを受け、冷泉家住宅のみ2001年秋に抽選の当選者に限って初めて5日間公開された。
sen.e: Both the residence and the manuscripts had not been open to the public for a very long time, but having received aid from the "Great Heisei Repairs" (a nationwide effort to restore old buildings to their ancient appearance) which lasted from 1994 to 2000, the Reizei residence only was opened to the public for the first time--but only to winners of a special lottery--for five days in the fall of 2001.

Both the residence and the manuscripts had not been open to the public for a very long time, but having received aid from the Great Heisei Repairs (a nationwide effort to restore old buildings to their ancient appearance) which lasted from 1994 to 2000, the Reizei residence only was opened to the public for the first time--but only to winners of a special lottery--for five days in the fall of 2001.
sen.cmt: Didn't think we needed quotation marks here so I removed them.
sen.e: Both the residence and the manuscripts had not been open to the public for a very long time, but having received aid from the Great Heisei Repairs (a nationwide effort to restore old buildings to their ancient appearance) which lasted from 1994 to 2000, the Reizei residence only was opened to the public for the first time--but only to winners of a special lottery--for five days in the fall of 2001.

sen.j: 2005年以降は毎年秋に4日間に限って主催の「非公開文化財特別拝観」の一環として、冷泉家住宅の一般公開が行われており、有料ではあるが予約・抽選などは無く誰でも見学ができる。
sen.e: Starting in 2005, another step was taken towards opening the Reizei residence to the public, in that now it is opened every autumn--for only four days--for a sponsored "special viewing of privately owned cultural properties" to the general public, and although an admission fee is charged, now anyone can come examine the building, without reservations or lotteries.

Starting in 2005, another step was taken towards opening the Reizei residence to the public, in that now it is opened every autumn--for only four days--for a sponsored "special viewing of privately owned cultural properties" to the general public, and although an admission fee is charged, now anyone can come examine the building, without reservations or lotteries.

Starting in 2005, another step was taken towards opening the Reizei residence to the public, in that now it is opened every autumn--for only four days--for a sponsored 'special viewing of privately owned cultural properties' to the general public, and although an admission fee is charged, now anyone can come examine the building, without reservations or lotteries.

sen.j: なお公開は台所土間以外は住宅外から室内を見学する形となり、室内に上がることはできない。
sen.e: However, with the exception of the earthen floor of the kitchen, on which visitors can walk, the building, although open to the public, must be viewed from the outside; it is not possible to enter the main building.

However, with the exception of the earthen floor of the kitchen, on which visitors can walk, the building, although open to the public, must be viewed from the outside; it is not possible to enter the main building.

However, with the exception of the earthen floor of the kitchen, on which visitors can walk, the building, although open to the public, must be viewed from the outside; it is not possible to enter the main building.

sen.j: 室内には絵画や工芸品などの展示が行われる。
sen.e: Inside the rooms, there is a display of paintings and other works of art.
Inside the rooms, there is a display of paintings and other works of art.
Inside the rooms, there is a display of paintings and other works of art.

sen.j: 「御文庫」と「台所蔵」の内部の公開はされず、外観のみの見学となる。
sen.e: The interior of the "obunko" (library) and the kitchen storehouse have not been opened to the public, and can only be viewed from the exterior.
The interior of the obunko and the kitchen storehouse have not been opened to the public, and can only be viewed from the exterior.
sen.cmt: Removed quotation marks and English translation as it had been given above.
sen.e: The interior of the obunko and the kitchen storehouse have not been opened to the public, and can only be viewed from the exterior.

tit.e: Cultural properties owned by the Reizei family
Cultural properties owned by the Reizei family
Cultural properties owned by the Reizei family

sen.j: 古今和歌集（藤原定家筆）1帖 附：後土御門天皇宸翰消息・後柏原天皇宸翰詠草・後奈良天皇宸翰消息1巻
sen.e: One jo ("large section," hereafter translated as "section") of the Kokin wakashu (a Collection of Waka Poems from Ancient and Modern Times, usually abbreviated to "Kokinshu"), written by FUJIWARA no Teika; Supplement: one scroll containing Emperor Go-Tsuchimikado's official letters and personal writings, Emperor Go-Kashiwara's official letters as well as poem drafts he personally wrote, and Emperor Go-Nara's official letters and personal writings.

One jo ("large section," hereafter translated as "section") of the Kokin wakashu (a Collection of Waka Poems from Ancient and Modern Times, usually abbreviated to "Kokinshu"), written by FUJIWARA no Teika; Supplement: one scroll containing Emperor Go-Tsuchimikado's official letters and personal writings, Emperor Go-Kashiwara's official letters as well as poem drafts he personally wrote, and Emperor Go-Nara's official letters and personal writings.

One jo ("large section," hereafter translated as "section") of the Kokin wakashu (a Collection of Waka Poems from Ancient and Modern Times, usually abbreviated to "Kokinshu"), written by FUJIWARA no Teika; Supplement: one scroll containing Emperor Gotsuchimikado's official letters and personal writings, Emperor Gokashiwara's official letters as well as poem drafts he personally wrote, and Emperor Gonara's official letters and personal writings.

sen.j: 後撰和歌集（藤原定家筆）1帖
sen.e: One section of the Gosen wakashu, or "Later Selected Waka Anthology" (written by Teika himself).
One section of the Gosen wakashu, or Later Selected Waka Anthology (written by Teika himself).
One section of the Gosen wakashu, or Later Selected Waka Anthology (written by Teika himself).

sen.j: 拾遺愚草（藤原定家自筆本）3帖 附：草稿断簡1幅－定家の自撰歌集。
sen.e: Three sections of Shuiguso (Gleanings of Worthless Weeds), written in Teika's own hand; Supplement: one section of Soko dankan (drafts and fragments), a waka anthology personally compiled by Teika.
Three sections of Shuiguso (Gleanings of Worthless Weeds), written in Teika's own hand; Supplement: one section of Soko dankan (drafts and fragments), a waka anthology personally compiled by Teika.
Three sections of Shuiguso (Gleanings of Worthless Weeds), written in Teika's own hand; Supplement: one section of Soko dankan (drafts and fragments), a waka anthology personally compiled by Teika.

sen.j: 中世以前の歌人の自撰・自筆の歌集としては日本で唯一のものである。
sen.e: It is the sole surviving poetry anthology from pre-medieval Japan compiled by the poet himself and completed in the poet's own hand.
It is the sole surviving poetry anthology from pre-medieval Japan compiled by the poet himself and completed in the poet's own hand.
It is the sole surviving poetry anthology from pre-medieval Japan compiled by the poet himself and completed in the poet's own hand.

sen.j: 古来風躰抄（藤原俊成自筆本）2帖
sen.e: Two sections of Korai futeisho, or "Notes on Poetic Style Through the Ages" (written in FUJIWARA no Toshinari's own hand).

sen.j: 附土塀、庭塀、供待及び台所門、立蔀
sen.e: The earthen wall, the garden wall, the tomosaburai (a waiting room for servants) as well as the kitchen gate, and the tatejitomi (a movable fence).
The earthen wall, the garden wall, the tomosaburai (a waiting room for servants) as well as the kitchen gate, and the tatejitomi (a movable fence).

sen.j: なお、主要な典籍については冷泉家時雨亭叢書として影印本が朝日新聞出版から刊行されている。
sen.e: The Reizei holdings have been published in facsimile by the Asahi Newspaper Company under the title "the Reizei Shigure-tei Series."
sen.cmt: The Japanese seems to be missing the title of the series, which is present in the Wikipedia article.
